dict.string:
require_cmd "${TM_SVN:=svn}" "If you have installed svn, then you need to either update your <tt>PATH</tt> or set the <tt>TM_SVN</tt> shell variable (e.g. in Preferences / Advanced)"
revs=$("$TM_SVN" log -q "$TM_FILEPATH"|grep -v '^-*$' \ 2> >(CocoaDialog progressbar --indeterminate \ --title "View Revision…" \ --text "Retrieving List of Revisions…" \ ))
revs=`osascript<<END set AppleScript's text item delimiters to {"\n","\r"} tell app "SystemUIServer" activate set ourList to (every text item of "$revs") if the count of items in ourList is 0 then display dialog "No older revisions of file '$(basename "$TM_FILEPATH")' found" buttons ("OK") set the result to false else choose from list ourList with prompt "View '$(basename "$TM_FILEPATH")' revision:" end if end tell END`
# exit if user canceled if [[ $revs = "false" ]]; then osascript >/dev/null 2>&1 -e 'tell application "TextMate" to activate' & exit_discard fi
revs=`echo "$revs" | tr '\r' '\n' | cut -d "|" -f 1` revs=( $revs )
rev1=${revs[0]#r}
"$TM_SVN" cat -r "$rev1" "$TM_FILEPATH" \ 2> >(CocoaDialog progressbar --indeterminate \ --title "View Revision…" \ --text "Retrieving Revision ${rev1} of “${TM_FILENAME}”…" \ )
